about.title: A bit more about me
about.part1: I’m a frontend developer (React / TypeScript), with a strong focus on code quality, accessibility, and maintainable user interfaces.
about.part1Bis: I spent 14 months within Société Générale’s Design System, contributing to the creation and evolution of reusable UI components in a demanding banking environment.
about.part2: After 15 years working in financial controlling for large companies, I decided to transition into frontend development.
about.part2Bis: I trained with OpenClassrooms (web development, then React specialization) and recently completed my Application Developer (CDA) degree at Wild Code School.
about.part3: I am now looking for my first frontend developer position. I want to join a team where I can keep growing technically while contributing in a reliable and meaningful way, with an approach focused on understanding needs, structuring solutions, and delivering quality work.
about.part4: My hybrid background allows me to bring perspective, rigor, and a strong sense of responsibility, while staying open to learning and continuous improvement.

description.part1: What I apply concretely in my frontend projects
description.part2: based on my experience in a Design System and my CDA project

part1.title: Design & conception
part1.summary: Analyze user stories and choose appropriate solutions
details: Reading and understanding user stories and functional constraints
Identifying edge cases (empty states, errors, loading states)
Choosing simple and appropriate solutions, avoiding over-engineering

part2.title: Interface structure
details: Breaking down interfaces into clear and well-defined components
Reusing existing components before creating new ones
Following shared naming and structural conventions

part3.title: Frontend quality
part3.summary: Pay attention to quality, accessibility, and maintainability
details: Writing readable and strongly typed code with TypeScript
Considering accessibility from the integration phase (semantics, focus, contrast)

part4.title: Code evolution
details: Analyzing existing code before making changes
Applying targeted fixes rather than full rewrites

part5.title: Collaboration
part5.summary: Work effectively with designers and product teams
details: Regular exchanges with designers and product teams
Taking feedback into account and iterating accordingly

skills.intro: My goal is to adopt a pragmatic, quality-oriented approach: understand the need, design an appropriate solution, and deliver clean, maintainable, and reliable code.
